dialogue: Well, Feldspur, we've been spurned by a girl. I guess there's a first time for everything!
Were you looking for something? Or-- someone?
No, I was... what was I doing?
How should I know?
Our first fight.
Well, I promised to give a guided tour to any recently arrived students, so...
Oh, wait... are you...?
I am. Though I'm sure I won't last longer at this school than at any of the others.
But I wasn't at any of your other schools.
I see! So many to choose from.
What do you do for fun around here?
Nothing. Until now.
You're good.
It was nothing. I love helping others. Oh, and I happen to be free tonight. After all--
Of course she does. She just pretends not to.
I feel awful.
Why? It's not like it's your fault.
May I cut in?
Elphaba. I'm happy for you.
Yes, we are both so happy for you!
I've been thinking.
Oh, me too! I think about it constantly. Poor Doctor Dillamond-- it makes one want to take a stand. In fact-- attention, everyone!
I am-- changing my name.
Your name?
Since Doctor Di llamond had his own, Goat-like way of pronouncifying my name-- in solidarity, and to express my... uh... outrage...
I will henceforward be known-- no longer as "Ga-linda"... but as simply: "Glinda."
